Agent.description: Represents an agent that can call the model and use tools.

id.description: The identifier, which can be referenced in API endpoints.

object.description: The object type, which is always assistant.

created_at.description: The Unix timestamp, in seconds, representing when this object was created.

model.description: The ID of the model to use.

instructions.description: The system instructions for the agent to use.

tools.description: The collection of tools enabled for the agent.

tool_resources.description:
A set of resources that are used by the agent's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter`
tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random,
while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass.
So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

response_format.description: The response format of the tool calls used by this agent.

metadata.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

id.description: The ID of the resource specified for deletion.

deleted.description: A value indicating whether deletion was successful.

object.description: The object type, which is always 'assistant.deleted'.

AgentErrorDetail.description: Describes the error information returned by the agents API.

type.description: Error type identifier (e.g. `invalid_request_error`).

param.description: Name of the parameter that caused the error, if applicable.

AgentStreamEvent.description:
Each event in a server-sent events stream has an `event` and `data` property:

```
event: thread.created
data: {"id": "thread_123", "object": "thread", ...}
```

We emit events whenever a new object is created, transitions to a new state, or is being
streamed in parts (deltas). For example, we emit `thread.run.created` when a new run
is created, `thread.run.completed` when a run completes, and so on. When an Agent chooses
to create a message during a run, we emit a `thread.message.created event`, a
`thread.message.in_progress` event, many `thread.message.delta` events, and finally a
`thread.message.completed` event.

We may add additional events over time, so we recommend handling unknown events gracefully
in your code.

values.name: ThreadCreated
values.description: Event sent when a new thread is created. The data of this event is of type AgentThread

values.name: ThreadRunCreated
values.description: Event sent when a new run is created. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunQueued
values.description: Event sent when a run moves to `queued` status. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunInProgress
values.description: Event sent when a run moves to `in_progress` status. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunRequiresAction
values.description: Event sent when a run moves to `requires_action` status. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunCompleted
values.description: Event sent when a run is completed. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunIncomplete
values.description: Event sent when a run ends incomplete. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunFailed
values.description: Event sent when a run fails. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunCancelling
values.description: Event sent when a run moves to `cancelling` status. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunCancelled
values.description: Event sent when a run is cancelled. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunExpired
values.description: Event sent when a run is expired. The data of this event is of type ThreadRun

values.name: ThreadRunStepCreated
values.description: Event sent when a new thread run step is created. The data of this event is of type RunStep

values.name: ThreadRunStepInProgress
values.description: Event sent when a run step moves to `in_progress` status. The data of this event is of type RunStep

values.name: ThreadRunStepDelta
values.description: Event sent when a run step is being streamed. The data of this event is of type RunStepDeltaChunk

values.name: ThreadRunStepCompleted
values.description: Event sent when a run step is completed. The data of this event is of type RunStep

values.name: ThreadRunStepFailed
values.description: Event sent when a run step fails. The data of this event is of type RunStep

values.name: ThreadRunStepCancelled
values.description: Event sent when a run step is cancelled. The data of this event is of type RunStep

values.name: ThreadRunStepExpired
values.description: Event sent when a run step is expired. The data of this event is of type RunStep

values.name: ThreadMessageCreated
values.description: Event sent when a new message is created. The data of this event is of type ThreadMessage

values.name: ThreadMessageInProgress
values.description: Event sent when a message moves to `in_progress` status. The data of this event is of type ThreadMessage

values.name: ThreadMessageDelta
values.description: Event sent when a message is being streamed. The data of this event is of type MessageDeltaChunk

values.name: ThreadMessageCompleted
values.description: Event sent when a message is completed. The data of this event is of type ThreadMessage

values.name: ThreadMessageIncomplete
values.description: Event sent before a message is completed. The data of this event is of type ThreadMessage

values.name: Error
values.description: Event sent when an error occurs, such as an internal server error or a timeout.

values.name: Done
values.description: Event sent when the stream is done.

tool_resources.description:
A set of resources that are used by the agent's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter`
tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random,
while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass.
So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

response_format.description: The response format of the tool calls used by this agent.

metadata.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

CreateAndRunThreadOptions.description: The details used when creating and immediately running a new agent thread.

assistant_id.description: The ID of the agent for which the thread should be created.

thread.description: The details used to create the new thread. If no thread is provided, an empty one will be created.

tools.description: The overridden list of enabled tools the agent should use to run the thread.

tool_resources.description: Override the tools the agent can use for this run. This is useful for modifying the behavior on a per-run basis

stream.description:
If `true`, returns a stream of events that happen during the Run as server-sent events,
terminating when the Run enters a terminal state with a `data: [DONE]` message.

temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output
more random, while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model
considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass. So 0.1 means only the tokens
comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

max_prompt_tokens.description:
The maximum number of prompt tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only
the number of prompt tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of prompt tokens specified,
the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

max_completion_tokens.description:
The maximum number of completion tokens that may be used over the course of the run. The run will make a best effort to use only
the number of completion tokens specified, across multiple turns of the run. If the run exceeds the number of completion tokens
specified, the run will end with status `incomplete`. See `incomplete_details` for more info.

truncation_strategy.description: The strategy to use for dropping messages as the context windows moves forward.

tool_choice.description: Controls whether or not and which tool is called by the model.

response_format.description: Specifies the format that the model must output.

parallel_tool_calls.description: If `true` functions will run in parallel during tool use.

values.name: uploaded
values.description:
The file has been uploaded but it's not yet processed. This state is not returned by Azure OpenAI and exposed only for
compatibility. It can be categorized as an inactive state.

values.name: pending
values.description: The operation was created and is not queued to be processed in the future. It can be categorized as an inactive state.

values.name: running
values.description: The operation has started to be processed. It can be categorized as an active state.

values.name: processed
values.description: The operation has successfully processed and is ready for consumption. It can be categorized as a terminal state.

values.name: error
values.description: The operation has completed processing with a failure and cannot be further consumed. It can be categorized as a terminal state.

values.name: deleting
values.description:
The entity is in the process to be deleted. This state is not returned by Azure OpenAI and exposed only for compatibility.
It can be categorized as an active state.

values.name: deleted
values.description:
The entity has been deleted but may still be referenced by other entities predating the deletion. It can be categorized as a
terminal state.

ThreadMessageOptions.description:
A single message within an agent thread,
as provided during that thread's creation for its initial state.

role.description:
The role of the entity that is creating the message. Allowed values include:
`user`, which indicates the message is sent by an actual user (and should be
used in most cases to represent user-generated messages), and `assistant`,
which indicates the message is generated by the agent (use this value to insert
messages from the agent into the conversation).

The content of the initial message. This may be a basic string (if you only
need text) or an array of typed content blocks (for example, text, image_file,
image_url, and so on).

ToolResources.description:
A set of resources that are used by the agent's tools. The resources are specific to the type of
tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search`
tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

code_interpreter.description: Resources to be used by the `code_interpreter` tool consisting of file IDs.

file_search.description: Resources to be used by the `file_search` tool consisting of vector store IDs.

azure_ai_search.description: Resources to be used by the `azure_ai_search` tool consisting of index IDs and names.

mcp.description: Resources to be used by the `mcp` tool consisting of a server label and headers.

TruncationObject.description:
Controls for how a thread will be truncated prior to the run. Use this to control the initial
context window of the run.

type.description:
The truncation strategy to use for the thread. The default is `auto`. If set to `last_messages`, the thread will
be truncated to the `lastMessages` count most recent messages in the thread. When set to `auto`, messages in the middle of the thread
will be dropped to fit the context length of the model, `max_prompt_tokens`.

values.name: auto
values.description: Default value. Messages in the middle of the thread will be dropped to fit the context length of the model.

values.name: lastMessages
values.description: The thread will truncate to the `lastMessages` count of recent messages.

last_messages.description: The number of most recent messages from the thread when constructing the context for the run.

TruncationStrategy.description: Possible truncation strategies for the thread.

values.name: auto
values.description: Default value. Messages in the middle of the thread will be dropped to fit the context length of the model.

values.name: lastMessages
values.description: The thread will truncate to the `lastMessages` count of recent messages.

UpdateAgentOptions.description: The request details to use when modifying an existing agent.

model.description: The ID of the model to use.

name.description: The modified name for the agent to use.

description.description: The modified description for the agent to use.

instructions.description: The modified system instructions for the new agent to use.

tools.description: The modified collection of tools to enable for the agent.

tool_resources.description:
A set of resources that are used by the agent's tools. The resources are specific to the type of tool. For example,
the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires a list of vector store IDs.

temperature.description:
What sampling temperature to use, between 0 and 2. Higher values like 0.8 will make the output more random,
while lower values like 0.2 will make it more focused and deterministic.

top_p.description:
An alternative to sampling with temperature, called nucleus sampling, where the model considers the results of the tokens with top_p probability mass.
So 0.1 means only the tokens comprising the top 10% probability mass are considered.

We generally recommend altering this or temperature but not both.

response_format.description: The response format of the tool calls used by this agent.

metadata.description: A set of up to 16 key/value pairs that can be attached to an object, used for storing additional information about that object in a structured format. Keys may be up to 64 characters in length and values may be up to 512 characters in length.

A set of resources that are made available to the agent's tools in this thread. The resources are specific to the
type of tool. For example, the `code_interpreter` tool requires a list of file IDs, while the `file_search` tool requires
a list of vector store IDs

The number of tokens that overlap between chunks. The default value is 400.
Note that the overlap must not exceed half of max_chunk_size_tokens.
